Name: Deploy ispac SSIS project from a package
Description: This step template will deploy SSIS ispac projects to SQL Server Integration Services Catalog

Parameters.Name: ServerName
Parameters.Label: Database server name (\instance)
Parameters.HelpText: Name of the SQL Server you are deploying to.

Parameters.Name: EnableCLR
Parameters.Label: Enable SQL CLR
Parameters.HelpText: This will reconfigure SQL Server to enable the SQL CLR.  It is highly recommended that this be previously authorized by your Database Administrator.

Parameters.Name: CatalogName
Parameters.Label: Catalog name
Parameters.HelpText: Name of the catalog to create in Integration Services Catalogs on SQL Server.  When using the GUI, this value gets hardcoded to SSISDB and cannot be changed.  It is recommended that you do not change the default value.

Parameters.Name: CatalogPwd
Parameters.Label: Catalog password
Parameters.HelpText: Password to the Integration Services Catalog.

Parameters.Name: FolderName
Parameters.Label: Folder name
Parameters.HelpText: Name of the folder to use within the Integration Services Catalog

Parameters.Name: ProjectName
Parameters.Label: Project name
Parameters.HelpText: Name of the project within the folder of the Integration Services catalog

Parameters.Name: UseEnvironment
Parameters.Label: Use environment
Parameters.HelpText: This will make a project reference to the defined environment.

Parameters.Name: EnvironmentName
Parameters.Label: Environment name
Parameters.HelpText: Name of the environment to reference the project to. If the environment doesn't exist, it will create it.

Parameters.Name: ReferenceProjectParametersToEnvironmentVairables
Parameters.Label: Reference project parameters to environment variables
Parameters.HelpText: Checking this box will make Project Parameters reference Environment Variables.  If the Environment Variable doesn't exist, it will create it.  This expects that an Octopus variable of the same name exists.

Parameters.Name: ReferencePackageParametersToEnvironmentVairables
Parameters.Label: Reference package parameters to environment variables
Parameters.HelpText: Checking this box will make Package Parameters reference Environment Variables.  If the Environment Variable doesn't exist, it will create it.  This expects than an Octopus variable of the same name exists.

Parameters.Name: NugetPackageStepName
Parameters.Label: NuGet package step
Parameters.HelpText: The step that uploaded the NuGet package to the server.

Parameters.Name: UseFullyQualifiedVariableNames
Parameters.Label: Use Fully Qualified Variable Names
Parameters.HelpText: When true the package variables names must be represented in `dtsx_name_without_extension.variable_name`

Parameters.Name: UseCustomFilter
Parameters.Label: Use Custom Filter for connection manager properties
Parameters.HelpText: Custom filter should contain the regular expression for ignoring properties when setting will occur during the auto-mapping

Parameters.Name: CustomFilter
Parameters.Label: Custom Filter for connection manager properties
Parameters.HelpText: Regular expression for filtering out the connection manager properties during the auto-mapping process. This string is used when `UseCustomFilter` is set to true

Parameters.Name: SyncEnvironment
Parameters.Label: Clean obsolete variables from environment
Parameters.HelpText:
When `true` synchronizes the environment:
- Removes obsolete variables
- Removes renamed variables
- Replaces values of valid variables (also when `false`)
